subject: Business
title: Subscription vs. One-Time Revenue
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Subscription vs. One-Time Revenue.

hook.text: Adobe switched from selling Photoshop for $999 to $21 per month. Revenue tripled.

buildup.text: One-time revenue spikes and drops. Subscription revenue compounds month over month.

discovery.text: Subscriptions create predictable cash flow, making planning, hiring, and investing far easier.

twist.text: Subscription fatigue is real. Consumers now juggle dozens of monthly charges and resent new ones.

climax.text: The winner is whichever model matches your value: ongoing value suits subscriptions.

punchline.text: Charge once for a moment. Charge monthly for a relationship.

quiz.question: Why did Adobe's revenue triple after switching to subscriptions?
